SEARCH
Package fang2.sprites

Class ArcSprite

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.Sprite
fang2.sprites.ArcSprite
public class ArcSprite extends Sprite
This class represents a circular arc as a Sprite. This arc is defined as part of a full oval by a start and end angle around the oval. The angles are specified such that 45 degrees falls halfway up between the width and height ratio of the oval. The arc sweeps around counter-clockwise from the start angle to the end angle. For example, given 0 and 180 as the start and end angles, defines an arc over the top half of the oval; but given 180 and 0 as the start and end angles, defines an arc over the bottom half of the oval. The arc is enclosed by drawing a straight line from the start of the arc segment to the end of the arc segment.

    Makes a Sprite that looks like an arc that goes from the given start angle to the given end angle, on an oval proportioned according to the given width and height ratio.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArcSprite

      public ArcSprite(double start, double end)
      Makes a Sprite that looks like a circular arc, i.e., its width and height ratio is 1:1, that goes from the given start angle to the given end angle.
      Parameters:
      start - beginning angle in degrees of the arc
      end - ending angle in degrees of the arc

    • ArcSprite

      public ArcSprite(double width, double height, double start, double end)
      Makes a Sprite that looks like an arc that goes from the given start angle to the given end angle, on an oval proportioned according to the given width and height ratio. The magnitude of the width and height only matter with respect to each other. For example, a Sprite constructed with a width 2 and height 1 is the same as making the width 20 and the height 10 because they both have the same height/width aspect ratio of 2.
      Parameters:
      width - width scale of the rectangle
      height - height scale of the rectangle
      start - beginning angle in degrees of the arc
      end - ending angle in degrees of the arc
